PREFAOE.

*CAESAR'S ‘ Invasion of Britain’ is intended as a first Translation Book. The text, which has been taken from Books IV. and V. of the Gallic War, has been simplified as much as possible3 the various construc- tions being introduced gradually to the learner’s notice. On each construction will be found one or more exercises and an explanation or rule.

An English vocabulary has been added at the request of the Publishers, and the obJection raised to such a vocabulary in the Introduction to the Eutropius has been overcome by giving a reference to the chap- ter or vocabulary where the word occurs instead of giving the Latin word itself.
